page.title: 03SERVICES IN AYLMERTON
page.content: The village has lost a shop, public house and bus service over the last 20 years. A shop and post office on the A148 are used for some provisions. A mobile shop, baker, butcher, fish van, and mobile library visit the village regularly, but the majority of people travel to Cromer or Sheringham for most of their{shopping. } The lack of{bus services}- there are two buses a week which pass through the village - mean that most people use their own car when shopping. {Car {ownership}is high in the working age-groups. The{Primary School}closed in 1978, and children travel to Gresham by school bus. Other services are only found outside the village. 71% of those interviewed visit a{doctor}in Cromer (21% Sheringham), 67% visit a{dentist} in Cromer (24% Sheringham).
